course_description: This course introduces program management principles and the history, ethical dimensions, and scope of reproductive health problems, programs, and policies. Lectures and in-class case studies will examine managing and implementing programs in socially diverse settings. Students will learn contextually appropriate management skills in program development, implementation and logistics, budgeting, monitoring, evaluation and using logic models, as well as team dynamics and leadership. Students will apply learned skills in ethical reflections, case studies, and a final project.
sections: Class Nbr: 3178, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: T 10-11:50a, Instructor: Newton-Levinson/Rice, Status: Open
